Package com.example

Class Repository

java.lang.Object
com.example.Repository
public class Repository
extends java.lang.Object
A class representing a Github Repository retrieved from a PushEvent
See Also:
PushEvent

    java.lang.String statusesUrl

    java.lang.String url
    URL linking to the Repository's Github page

  • Constructor Details

    • Repository

      public Repository​(com.google.gson.JsonElement repoElement)
      Make a new Repository from a JsonElement representing a Github repo. This JsonElement must be retrieved from the Github API's Push Event
      Parameters:
      repoElement - JsonElement representing the repo
      See Also:
      PushEvent

  • Method Details

    • cloneRepository

      public org.eclipse.jgit.api.Git cloneRepository​(java.lang.String branch, java.lang.String target) throws java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException
      Clone the repository based on the clone URL retrieved in the JSON and checkout the given branch.
      Parameters:
      branch - branch to check out after commit
      target - directory to clone the repository in. must be empty!
      Returns:
      JGit instance that allows to call commands on the repository
      Throws:
      java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException - when the target directory is not empty. not emptied automatically for safety reasons
      See Also:
      x the returned value, JGit API method called

    • clean

      public void clean()
      Clean up this repository's disk/memory usage by releasing the JGit reference and deleting the working dir along with its content
      See Also:
      set to null after method call, set to null after method call, clean JGit command called, freeing JGit command called

    • directory

      @Nullable public java.lang.String directory()
      Get the directory the repository has been cloned in.
      Returns:
      this repository's directory path or null if the repository hasn't been cloned / has been cleaned
      See Also:
      the returned value, the method that sets the Repository#directory, the method that resets Repository#directory

    • git

      @Nullable public org.eclipse.jgit.api.Git git()
      Get the JGit Git instance of the repository has been cloned in.
      Returns:
      this repository's git handle
      See Also:
      the returned value, the method that sets the Repository#git, the method that resets Repository#git

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Formats the repo to a readable string format
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the repo in a string format
